page.pageNote: Advertisements, columns 1-3; account of the previous Saturday's fighting at Fort Donelson, column 4; an incident in the storming of Fort Donelson, column 5; article refuting the claim that the Senate has signed a treaty with Mexico agreeing that the United States would loan Mexico money to pay all of its creditors, column 5

div.head: Apportionment of the Direct Tax
div.summary: Relates that Mr. Sellers, the "able, young and energetic" Representative from Fulton County has proposed that part of the direct tax owed by Pennsylvania to the federal government might be raised by imposing a tax on the salaries of state, county, city, and district officers. The Dispatch applauds this plan.

Reports that Captain Nathaniel Gordon has been hanged in New York after being convicted of engaging in the slave trade. Captain Gordon was the first to be executed under the laws that were enacted forty years earlier.

div.head: Immense Federal Spoils of War
div.summary: Reports that the government has captured rebel property amounting to two million dollars in value.

page.pageNote: Anecdote concerning the fame of General Scott, column 1; more news from Fort Donelson, columns 2 and 3; news from Europe, column 3; news from Fortress Monroe, column 4; advertisements, columns 4 and 5

div.head: The First of the Season
div.summary: Reports that the previous day was "quite blustery" and that the first thunder of the season was heard.

div.head: Released
div.summary: Reports that Mr. George W. Walker of Waynesboro' in Franklin County was among the prisoners recently released from Richmond. He had been held since being captured at Martinsburg, Virginia, last July.

div.head: Strange Disease
div.summary: Reports that the cattle of William Smith of Oakville last week contracted a disease that causes the cows to rub their heads and nose until the skin is rubbed off and, in some cases, the eye rubbed out. Urges persons who might have information concerning a cure for the disease to contact Mr. Smith.

div.head: The 22d in Chambersburg
div.summary: Reports that despite gloomy weather and mud, the people of Chambersburg celebrated Washington's Birthday with enthusiasm. Details the activities.

div.head: Battle of Bloomer's Gap
div.summary: Reports military activity that occurred on February 13 at Paw-Paw Bottom, Virginia.

page.pageNote: Proceedings of Congress, column 1; prices current, column 2; advertisements, columns 2-5
